pr_title: Bugfix/added a scroll bar to feedback editor

timeline.message: Bugfix/added a scroll bar to feedback editor
Bugfix/set overflow-y to auto and let text area grow to a maximum of two rows
created an extra function for setting the max height of the text area
delete .gitignore as it was an accidental commit

timeline.bodyText:
Is this the desired behavior?
Wouldn't it be preferred to have all elements at the needed height and not require scrolling here?
timeline.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText: Yes. I used @filip-gregurevic suggestion (see the comment above)j, to let it expand to a certain height and if less text is entered (<2 lines), then only this (1 line e.g.) is shown. Would you prefer a different behaviour? The second line in the method seems to be redundant though (deleted that in new push)
replies.author: tessaRuckstuhl

replies.bodyText:
So you are using this more than I am, so I am open to everything. :)
My personal preference is to reduce scrolling within scrollable content as much as possible.
replies.author: jpbernius

replies.bodyText:
That's true.
As the text area expands (and stays expanded) while editing and only reduces in size on reopening, scrolling is reduced anyways. Though when reopening and decreasing the text box sizes, it lets everyting appear very structured and clear. So I think this is a nice compromise :).
replies.author: tessaRuckstuhl

timeline.message: removed scrolling to instead showing whole content of feedback textarea on load
